review: My boyfriend and I celebrated V-Day weekend here on Saturday night and it wasn't even our first pick. We planned to go to Joe's Crab Shack, just up the street, but after being told the wait would be at least an hour, we were out of there. We had talked in the past about going to Friday's, but hadn't been there together before. We went in and it was crowded to be sure, but we had assurance from the host that he would have us seated in 20 to 25 minutes and he delivered. This was very impressive, considering they were packed and had several group parties waiting. My next concern was the quality of the food, as I know that when restaurants get crowded, food and service tend to suffer. We were starving, so we started with an appetizer of potstickers, which I'd eaten at other places before, but my boyfriend had never tried. They were absolutely delicious and the price was right for six of them. They and the drinks arrived in a very timely manner, and no more than ten minutes after we finished the appetizer, did the entrees arrive. I ordered ribs and my boyfriend ordered a steak. Everything was cooked to order, at the temperature it was meant to be and my ribs had the meat falling off the bone. No utensils needed and zero toughness. Same went for Jarvis' steak, who ordered his well done. The service was spectacular and our waiter was just being himself and genuinely kind at that! I even saw the manager working the floor: seating, busing tables, serving food and drinks, he was on top of it all. Jarvis and I were very pleased with our experience from when we walked in to when we walked out and that is why I'm giving TGI Friday's on Mt. Zion Blvd. a 5 star rating!

This was by far my worst Fridays experience! The service was slow our server have a terrible attitude and made it seem like we were out of line for asking him for a refill on our drinks after waiting for a while for him to notice. My wife ordered the sizzling chicken and cheese her usual dish when we go at out Fridays in Cali, but this time the vegetables were way to big and this was a total mistake going here

Having lunch right now and we ordered off the $10 pick two meal. I'm not surprised that the manager passed by without asking how was the food because he knows it was nasty.  My mother ordered the Parmesan crusted flounder, which was just fish with raw bread crumbs tossed on it. No flavor at all bland just like the white rice.  This is just horrible food at cheap price, regretted going at all.  I fell out of love when they stopped serving my favorite dish--cedar seared salmon over pasta with zucchini, yum BRING THAT BACK

Now as a person in the industry I am very forgiving when it comes to service, but  we received some of the worst service ever. When we seated we sat there for a good 5 min before being approached by our waitress. We received no apologizes or even a name from here just a quick what can I get you to to drink. When she finally came to take order she did so without writing it down. We ordered an appetizer and two entrees. The appetizer never came and the meal came out slightly off. The steak was missing the Jack Daniels sauce that it was supposed to be marinated in. My burger was fine. Even after giving awful service the entire time when she greeted us with the check she finally gave us a wide smile and said thank you guy have a great evening in hopes of getting a better tip than deserved. Won't be going back any time soon.

Slow service at the front door to be seated. Waited about 20 minutes before we got seated.  I had order ribs with vegetable and coleslaw on the side and not the fires.  When the food came out i got the ribs and fries with coleslaw and no silverware, but my order was wrong.  So i ask about my vegetable and she say sorry and went to get it, after she came out with more coleslaw, which she say oh i thought you was missing your coleslaw.  That when the manager walk by and check on us and took care of the problem and personal bought out my  vegetable and he assured us he will do everything to make it right.  Most of all the best part was the manager made an attempt to get it right for us and which he did.  Service will need some working.

My kids and I were in need of a little "us" time, so we ventured to Mt. Zion Rd.. My daughter wanted to use one of her "Reading Is It's Own Reward" coupons from school, so that pretty much sealed the deal on selecting T.G.I. Fridays. We were told it would be a 20 minute wait to find seating(even with the restaurant being only 60% full), and 20 minutes it was. We were seated and waited on by Pierre. Pierre did an awesome job, though you could tell that he was a little flustered. We ordered drinks, which took a little while to get to us. The Mango Peach slush...yum. We then ordered an app and our entrees, with the kids getting chicken strips, cheeseburger, fries, and a fruit salad. I ordered the Korean Steak Tacos cooked medium. (I keep setting myself up for failure regarding steak temperatures...) The food took about 30 minutes to get to us, with the kids' food coming first, then the app immediately after, and then my tacos. The appetizer, we ordered the Pick Three-For-All pretzels, Fried Mozzarella, and boneless wings. The mozzarella was COLD. It was so cold that the cheese solidified throughout the whole stick. I asked him to take it back, but by then the kids were eating it up, so I left it alone. The Korean Tacos were DELICIOUS! I didn't really care for the lettuce on top, they should substitute that for more cilantro, but oh man they were good! The jasmine rice had a garlicky flavor that I loved, and the Sriracha was perfect on the tacos. When I asked for the check, it took a while to do because Pierre kind of disappeared, but he still gave excellent service.  I don't know if there's a disconnect with the kitchen and the servers, or if they need more employees, but there's something amiss with T.G.I. Fridays. The food was fine, but the service...

They often get larger orders wrong when you call it in even when you have the person on the phone READ it BACK to you and it is CORRECT. This is because the person who reads it back to you is the hostess and not the person who keys it.  So they try to show you the receipt that was keyed (incorrectly) to show that you did not order something. And the only way of "proving" that something was really ordered is if the hostess admits that the mistake was theirs and that the person who keyed it, keyed it incorrectly.  They really need a better system for calling in orders. Seems like they are always messing up something. Three stars instead of two because if they are wrong, they will usually give you the meal on the house for the inconvenience.  But sometimes its such an inconvenience that I wish that I could give 2 1/2 stars. Not quite 2 stars, not quite 3.
Service is alright. The best thing here is the Jack Daniels burger! Lord I would eat that every day if I was allowed!

Service was great. Food was great for a corporated restaurant. My boyfriend and I ordered so much because everything sounded yummy. Pleased with our experience. The sweet tea was extremely sweet, however, and our waitress was like "it's that ghetto sweet tea huh" and she fixed right away. I've always loved TGIF, including those potato skins from the frozen aisle.

If I must give a star, it'll have to be a 1 star. My son and I walked in at 2:05PM today (Sat) and were seated pretty quickly.  From there we just sat and waited and waited until finally just walking out. That was at 2:28PM. No one bothered to come say "hello, I'll be right with you" or anything. Two thumbs down from us PS:  I heard one customer complaining because they took 15 minutes to come back with his credit card while he was trying to leave.

Great place to eat. Just recently had a major face lift to the interior and currently is under construction for exterior but still open. This location has frequent live bands and is always a good time.  I typically sit at the bar and the patrons are friendly and easy to talk with. Mark and Veronica are two kg the many awesome bartenders up there so ask for them then tip well when you get great service.  Food is always fresh and arrives in adequate time. This place does get busy for dinner so be prepared for a wait from time to time.  The new bar set up is great with plenty of flat screens.  Only downfall is parking can get crazy, I suggest not parking on the angled spots next to the building as it's very tight.
Worst service ever. Waited nearly an hour for our food until we walked out. Never coming here again.

My girlfriends and I decided to visit this location expecting to have a wait to be seated as it was a Friday night. We asked if we could visit the bar while we waited and were told the bar was full. By surprise we were seated in like less than 15 minutes.  My disappointed came when we sat and ordered our drinks it took over 40 minutes to get our drinks. By this time our meal came out. We spoke to a manager and nothing was really done about it as our second drink took just as long. Will not go back due to lack of service from the bar and the manager.
Went here today and enjoyed the endless appetizers so good. Amazing waiter named DJ went above and beyond to serve us. Loved it.

The nice hoster (never met a male hostess before) sat us in the bar area and proceeded to praise the newest dessert that was on the menu. If I was allergic to chocolate, I would have ordered it.  Our server was Devon and he was really nice. My and my friend both ordered a Jack Daniels steak, she got the ribeye, I got the sirloin. They're not worth the money. I had to fight to cut my steak which I ordered medium rare and she got a bloody steak and she ordered medium well. Devon was very prompt about getting our dinner back to the kitchen to voice our complaints. I didn't care for the fact he didn't even try to see if I wanted to order anything else...I didn't want to but it should have been asked. We witnessed him talking to the manager since we were so unhappy with our meals.....he never came over to the table. Just disregarded us like it didn't matter. The fact that hostesses and servers have more customer service experience than the manager is a damn shame. If I could have half a star, I would.

For over a decade this has been my favorite restaurant and still is. I did not have the best service but this meal will make you forget about not so good service. As long as I have this deliciousness I'm happy! My favorite dish is the jack Daniels steak & shrimp & always will be.

Came here with my son today to enjoy a nice afternoon lunch/dinner. I ordered the Jack Daniel's chicken and shrimp and he got the kids macaroni and fruit cup. My waitress was very young and slow to bring out the chips and salsa which actually ended up coming with our meals. The food was fine but everything quickly went downhill the moment I asked for a refill. Keep in mind that my glass was literally filled  75% with ice! This is no exaggeration! "Oh I'm sorry but that's gonna be an additional charge!"...I asked her could we make concession for this one occasion and she said no and that they would charge me. I asked for the manager who then came to my table and agreed to take care of me this one time and that next time it wouldn't be that way and I agreed. My waitress comes back to my table 15 mins later and asks do I still want the juice and I said yes! Then she said that her manager said she didn't agree to give me the refill. I then became flustered and requested that she come back to my table. This time a higher up manager comes wearing a collared shirt (typical rank status attire for restaurants). She then finally agrees to refill me and now I've been waiting 30 mins for a freaking refill of cranberry juice!!! This was a horrible experience considering the fact that it was only cranberry juice, not Patron or Belair champagne! When we arrived, I had to circle the parking lot and found the last parking spot wayyy in the back of the restaurant! This place is not hurting financially! However, they tried to make me feel as if their bottom line was going to be greatly effected by refilling my cup! What a sham! I'm a Network Engineer and paying for a refill is certainly within my budget but that doesn't mean that I will allow a place to mistreat me as customer! I will never patronize this location again! Fellow Yelpers do not come here. TGIFridays is still a great restaurant in my eyes but this location is not built on customer satisfaction !!!

Drink runner spilt alcohol all over my car key that costs 200 and my galaxy note 4 doesnt apologize my girlfriend almost finished her entire drink starts gagging at the table after finding a fly in it threw up in there bathroom the manager MONZEL JACKSON comes over to the table with a smart a$$ look on his face instead of apologizing he comps the drink....no gift card no discount..he has 0.00 customer service skills the food was good the waitress NONI was very pleasant and professional the host CHRIS was superb but i hope you fire the $hit out of that manager. We will not EVER BE BACK. we had a 178.00 bill bought 5 drinks 4 apps and 3 steak combos tipped $65.00 i hope there is another tgi fridays close but DO NOT visit this one.

Horrible experience. .... the kitchen was extra slow. Took over 40 minutes to get our food. Then my smoked stacked house burger was not as I ordered it. I asked for no mayo. ....I'm allergic. Returned to the kitchen and it was returned to me lukewarm with only the buns swapped out per the waitress. What?????? !!!
I like the grilled chicken cobb salad was really good with the 2 rolls n fruit punch haven't been there n a min....

Review from 12/22/15 about 6:00p.m. We walk in and are seated at a dirty table where there was food in the menus. We are greeted without a smile, without recommendations by Blanche about 5 minutes after being seated. I ask what the drink specials are and she basically throws the drink menu at me for me to look myself. We order House Long Island from the drink specials and water. She leaves and comes back about 5 minutes later w/o our drinks and ask are we ready to order. We order a burger and fries and the chicken skillet. Our drinks arrive and another server brings it to us w/o a straw. We attempt to stop another server to request for a straw who looked us in the eyes and said I will be right back but walks around to avoid where we were sitting. Our server comes back about 5 minutes later brings us straws and drops it off on the table w/o a word. We are finally brought our food about 10-12 minutes later after 2 tables were served before us after we were seated first. Food was hot and good. The server has yet to come back and fill up our waters or ask if we would like another drink, and we have yet to stop another server and request extra napkins and to fill our water. She comes back to the table and we just request for the  bill, she doesn't ask if everything is okay, how was the food or any dessert. When we receive the bill 2 minutes later we notice we were charged for the Ultimate Long Island. We tell her she rang this up wrong, she goes and speaks to Paula who said she will not take off the bill because we drank it. We requested to speak to Paula, she came and said well we should know that it was the Ultimate and not the House (although it was on the drink specials and I don't drink all the time), then said her server didn't ring it in wrong because they are trained not to but that we were lien. That her server wouldn't make an error. I was appalled that she felt her server walked on water especially with the crappy service along w/being called a liar. This is unacceptable. She finally took it off. I have never been called a liar by management! I will never come back to this establishment again!
The restaurant was very clean  the service was great food was fresh we had the endless  apps not bad at for $12. I think I might go back for drinks food was al that

Now I remember why I rarely go to chain establishment.  The service was horrible.  I sat at the bar.  I wasn't greeted in a timely fashion.  I ordered the mozzarella sticks and chicken and spinach.  What I received was not what I ordered.  I let the other bartender know and she tells me that she put a rush order.  Well I had time to clean out about 100 emails and I still had not received my food. I am heavily annoyed by this.  I tell I the bartender that I am tired and I am ready to go.  I no longer want to eat.  She runs to the back to grab my order.  Uh what part of I don't want it and I am tired did they not understand.  Why the urgency when I am ready to leave.  She brings it out my jacket is on and I am ready to go.  No tip which is rare for me.  I went down the street to Chik-fil-a at least I can get good service there.

Horrible service. Waited 20 mins every time I ordered a drink. I was sitting at a table next to the bar .  All the while watching two bartenders eating behind the bar and having fun not making drinks for anyone but people sitting at the bar.  Went to the manager and he said il take care of the drinks bc we still haven't received them .   Had to sit there still and watch him do nothing but flirt with the hostesses for 15 mins. When we finally received our ALREADY paid for drinks we left as far as possible. Don't go here!

Went on a Thursday night, I love that they had a side with a DJ with a great mix from 80s to now! I had the endless appetizers and my waiter was kind enough to keep them coming! We only had to wait 10 minutes for a table. Service was great and the atmosphere jamming! I would definitely go back!

I try to stray from leaving negative reviews for restaurants as I'm a server myself, but overall experiences here haven't been the best. Food quality has lessened over the years as well as service. The restaurant itself wasn't busy & what seemed like the server's section was not full. As we walked in, the hostess acknowledged us but was not friendly. No smile, not even a slight grin. Our server was friendly, but it did take him quite some time to even greet us. We ordered an appetizer and were given small plates for us to eat on. The plates were all dirty. It wasn't even small stuff where you can just wipe off.

I will not return to this location and its the closes to me. Every time I go the host are having personal conversations and finish their conversation before greeting me and my family. It was obviously a slow Sunday and plenty of tables were open and we were told there was a five to ten minute wait. The host continued their conversation instead of cleaning off a table to speed up the process. We waited our five minutes and with several tables available we left. The host then sarcastically asked "oh y'all leaving?" and said "oh okay, bye". I've served and hosted so I tend to try and explain the process to others but I've had way to many nasty attitudes at this location before im even seated... Smh
Waitresses are nice and knowledgeable. Service was fast,  they were not crowded and we were seated fairly quickly.  Overall it was an okay experience.

Good service.  Food came fast and was really good.  Drink specials were pretty good.  The bathrooms could hand Been cleaner and the music was more for a club setting. 8pm shouldn't warrant songs that are not family friendly.

YO, they just served me raw uncooked food. How do you not cook mahi-Mahi? They messed up the orders of the tables around me too. I will neeeeeeeeeeeeeever come back. Manager took care of the ticket. I appreciate that. But still not cling back ever

Use to be my favorite place but not anymore. The 3 hostesses at the front were more concerned with talking to themselves than seating me. Then when they did seat me, it was way in the back. I come here not only for the food but also for the atmosphere. The hostesses were ghetto and next time I will be more assertive and not let them seat me anywhere. Our waitress however was very understanding and when I asked for a strong drink, she came thru... Well at least the bartender did.

My Co workers and I decided to come here for lunch on a Thursday. I ordered the turkey burger and my co workers ordered the lunch special the cheddar broccoli soup and the California Chicken Club. my food was okay but one of my co workers were complaining about the smell of their sandwich. He took the chicken out of the sandwich and we all began to smell the stench. The chicken was spoiled. when we asked to speak to the manager after waiting 20 minutes the manager did not show up and the waitress said he took the price of the meal off of the bill. If this is how you deal with your customers I will pass on ever coming here again. A few hours after lunch my co worker was blowing chunks, he stomach was upset from what he had consumed at this restaurant. Unless you want food poisoning don't take your chances.
I concur with every other 1 star rating.  lazy employees, slow services, incompetent managers.  I'm happy I'm from out if town.

Trash. Table wasn't clean. Literally hadn't been completely cleared off and we were still sat. We were given napkins to finish wiping up on our own!!!! Wtf! The waitress was young, slightly awkward, but friendly. The food wasn't impressive and I eat the same thing EVERYTIME! Even the JD sauce tasted funny. Not coming back to this location. Ever.
Food was ok but the service  is  not  there  at all been waiting  for  ever to get a check and wow it's taken  longer then a prisoners release

I really had a good experience. The service was awesome and the food was good. I did have to send my burger and fries back because they were cold but the appetizers were hot and fresh. I loved the Garlic Parmesan Boneless wings!!!!
Everything is eh. Food...eh. Staff....eh. Waiter....eh. Price range....eh.  Unfortunately, this restaurant did not truly satisfy me.

This restaurant is a truly not what it use to be.  The menu is a joke options are slim to none my wife and I ate their Sunday March 5, 2017 The food was horrible we had the extended appetizers which is $10.00 dollars for 1 as opposed to we use to get 3 for $8 to $10 and each additional order is $5 to $6.  And we had the bf Margarita and they were really bad they made us sick it was a good was to waste $40 + dollars and be sick the rest of the day Beware.
Great lunch time option. Say at the bar. Service could be a little faster but overall good.

Ummm... It was ok. 4 adults. 1 toddler. 1 baby. I was told before arriving that I didn't need to reserve a table but once I got there the parking lot was packed and we had to wait to be seated I asked for fries with the kids meal and got fruit instead (no problem). Endless app? More like ONE APP!! The mozzarella sticks were good and hot; my fries were almost cold but the tenders were hot...either way there was hair on the tenders and fries. And the waitress was ok but she was just a snail. I might return but I'm not sure.

Just arrived and the hostess was looking at her social media page talking out loud. She never greeted me until said hello. It really disturbs me when a business is destroyed because of horrible customer service.

We arrived there around 10 this location closes at 12 midnight.When we walked in no one was there to greet us,suddenly someone appeared soon after 2 women appeared and they were talking loud and loudly saying "bruh send me home" all the while we were still waiting to be seated. When finally seated our server came over and was cursing so out of discomfort we laughed it off. The server recovered with excellent service and the food was great except for our fries being cold.
Our waiter was very friendly and made my lil girl feel very welcome. Our appetizers and entrees were fast and we were well taken care of. Ask for Angie, that was our waiter.

I mean hey this is a chain restaurant and I tend not to measure them the same way that I measure unique eateries.  TGI FRIDAYS is one of those places that is close to my apartment and I eat here once every couple of months and usually do not stop to do a review​ however due to them offering a new appetizer lineup I feel compelled to review them. Lately during my visits I have been enjoying the unlimited appetizers for $10..... just can't go wrong for all you can eat apps at this price.  I usually order the Jack Daniels boneless wings, mozzarella sticks, potstickers and as of recently​ the new meatballs that they have added to the lineup.  My last visit on Thursday, May 18th was uneventful for the most part. **Side note** stop forcing customers to order one appetizer at a time and stop refusing to give customers a to go box to take their food home.  If I'm paying for the food and get too full to finish it there I should not be hassled about getting a to go box to take the food that I paid for home.....all the staff is gonna do is throw the food in the garbage if I don't take it home anyway. I arrived alone as I had just reached the area after a long drive from work.  Upon entering I was greeted by a smiling hostess (always a good thing) and asked her if I could be seated at one of the small booths by the window.  She said yes but that the table needed to be cleaned and that I would need to wait about 15 minutes (3:30 in the afternoon, restaurant mostly empty so not sure why the wait to get the table cleaned, but ok).....fast forward 20 minutes later and I'm still standing at the door waiting to be seated. Finally she grabs a menu and walks me over to the booth but stops before I can​ sit down, now I'm being asked if I would like to sit at a table in the back by the restroom.  **Side note** I don't sit near restrooms when I eat at restaurants for obvious reasons! Told her that I want to be seated at the table that I had to wait 20 minutes for them to clean and asked her if there is some kind of problem.....that's when she told me that the server that normally takes care of this area had a family emergency and had to leave. **Side note** While stuff does happen to people and they have to leave work early the transition of staff (shift changes, emergencies etc.) should all be handled by staff so smoothly that the customer never notices the difference.  As a customer I'm coming to your establishment to enjoy the atmosphere, food and drink but don't want to be hassled about where I would like to sit especially when there are already people sitting in the same area..... somebody is taking care of their table so why not use common sense and ask them to cover the booth right behind the other customers?? Now as staff goes back n forth over this I'm beginning to get annoyed.... finally one server offers to cover the area and I can sit down oh but wait!  Nobody thought to clean the seat off so I had to ask for that to be done! Server was attentive, food was good and my glass was kept full with passionfruit tea.....Apps + tea total $13.49.   As I mentioned at the beginning of this review this is the level​ of service that I expect from a chain restaurant.   Left with a happy stomach and will continue to come.

I use to love Fridays, and desperately wanted to give them a 5 star but simply couldn't. Unfortunately this location seems to consistently be a two or three star restaurant. My boyfriend and his family decided to spend Valentine's Day at this location. The wait was no longer than 30 minutes which was nice especially since this was a holiday. Location: Located in Morrow, GA and the only Fridays accessible for both Henry and Clayton County residents. Nestled on Mount Zion near Publix, Carrabba's, and Taco Bell, this located is one of the top options for those who want a few drinks and a bite that isn't necessarily as upscale as Carrabba's may seem. Service: Tonight's service was actually one of the better times I've had at Fridays. Unfortunately there was a typical error with a few of our meals which did put a damper on the overall experience. Rewards Card: I do appreciate Friday's consistency with rewarding their frequent customers with a reward program called "Give Me Strips." For every dollar spent you receive 1 point.  The point system works in the following ways: 1. 50 points= Free Dessert 2. 80 points= Free Sandwich or Signature Burger 3. 100 points= $8 Off Food Purchase 4. 100 points= Free Chicken, Seafood, Salad, or Select Entree 5. 110 points= Free Stacked Burger 6. 150 points= Free Ribs or Steak Entree I did receive a free meal by using 100 of my points for the sizzling chicken and cheese meal. Which made this trip worth wild. One of the selling points for Friday's is this incentive. Pros: Location, Pricing, Desserts (Always Yummy), Drinks, Stripes Rewards Cons: Service is rarely consistently good, Food quality is a hit or miss.

This is the second time we have come to this location and the service sucked both times and this visit they ran out of hamburger buns but we are so hungry we gonna just stay the first time service was bad my food was cold and the waiter had to run out to his car for something so we waited until he came back to be served

This is one of those times I wish there was a zero star option. It started with there being a 45 minute wait for two people but upon walking into the restaurant one side was really empty and there were plenty of booths available on another side. I'll chalk this up to maybe then being short staffed in the kitchen and not wanting to be overwhelmed. The reason for the one star is the terrible attitude of the woman at the bar. We had to ask to be served after about 10-15 minutes of waiting (this was the case for mostly everyone who sat after us as well). We had to repeatedly ask her for things and she would rudely comment that she "didn't forget" and proceeded to forget lol I eventually asked another lady. They ran out of silverware at the bar and had to go to the back to get more, when she returned she said they didn't have any knives just forks.. wait what? How do you run out of knives? Can you not just wash more or was every knife owned in the restaurant in use? If I'm ever visiting the area again, this would not be my first choice of a meal.

I should of known better. Family was looking for somewhere to get out and stretch our legs on our way through to S. Carolina. Dinner @ 8pm on a Friday night, was not busy by any means. Waited way too long for drinks. A couple in our party waited so long for their food that everyone else at the table was finished eating when it finally arrived. And one just had soup n salad! I'm never one to complain but I had to go and find the manager. She cut 20% from the food order. Crappy place, crappy workers, standard food.

Server was excellent. Food was tasty!  Calendar in ladies room stated Thursday was Long Island Ice Tea for $4.  Great!  Uh no, says server, I must have read it wrong.  Go look.  Yes, your right, but a mistake.  Manager comes over and says she will honor the $4 for one round.  No problem.  Charged regular price on bill, not $4.  Had to discuss again with server, who was still polite and helpful.  She spoke to manager again, and had charge changed.  Manager never came by table to apologize for the confusion.  Then, found double charge on card next day!  Had to call.  GM was very helpful and apologetic!

This place sucks. The last 4 times I have been here, they always screw something up. First off, this time they changed a keg of Bud Light and it kept foaming. She just asked if I wanted something else instead. I said no, and evidently she just gave up on it. I figured she may try again, but she just ignored me and kept on with other people. Also, this place is always loud. Females usually sit on one side of the bar while males are on the other side. They yell across the bar at each other all the time trying to hit on the other one. Football season...forget it. Everyone here are armchair referees and it gets 100 times worse. I will never come back to this location.
I would give 0 stars if I could. TGIF no longer accepts vertical licenses if you are over 21 and it's not expired.

If I could give them no stars, that would still be too nice. My boyfriend and I came here excited for a date night last night and I would love to be able to give a nice honest review of their food, but unfortunately we weren't even able to eat any. We checked their hours on yelp before driving the half hour there, and saw that they were open until 11pm. We entered the restaurant at 9:15pm and stood in front of the hostess for nearly two minutes, with her eyeing me up and down before RUDELY telling my boyfriend and I that they are not seating anyone any longer and the kitchen was closed... SHE SAW US STANDING THERE FOR TWO MINUTES AND WASN'T DOING ANYTHING THAT ENTIRE TIME AND STILL DIDN'T SAY ANYTHING TO US FOR TWO MINUTES! We walked out the door livid, and went to the car to call and ask their hours directly. The person who answered the phone said the kitchen closes at 10... so tell me WHY we weren't seated if the kitchen closes at 10, the restaurant closes at 11, and we got there at 9:15? Not to mention that we could have just been going there for drinks and she didn't even bother to ask, she just turned us away. After calling while still waiting in the parking lot, we noticed lots of cars were still entering the parking lot and parking... Odd we thought, since they're not seating anyone any more. So we got out of the car and watched MULTIPLE groups of people (at least 5 different groups) enter the restaurant.... and guess what? Not one of them were turned away! So I went online to the actual TGI Fridays website to look at the hours for this particular location. Go figure it said they were open until midnight! At this point we were infuriated and stood outside the corner of the restaurant watching people enter for about 10 minutes in complete shock. The rude hostess must have seen this and came out the door and without saying a word, motioned for us to come inside. I said "excuse me?" And she said "you guys can come in now". I said "I thought you weren't seating anyone anymore and that you were closing", and she responded with some sort of mumble and "you can come in". We declined and left, hungry, disappointed and hurt. This isn't the first time we have been to this particular location and haven't felt welcome, but this has definitely been the most directed experience of hate. I'm not one to ever use the race card, but I feel as If it played a huge roll in this. We have been unsuccessful in contacting a manager thus far, but if by some chance anyone from management or corporate reads this, feel free to contact me.

I came in to this restaurant on a Monday afternoon. It took a long time for food to get here but when it did, food was COLD. And do not order the Endless appetizer. They DO NOT WANT to bring you food!  To top it off, i got sick few hours later. And when I spoke to the general manager named Allan, he was rude and have no sympathy for customers. Lesson from this: DO NOT ever got to his restaurant. The employees and management have no care attitude. Why carry a reputable name BUT the restaurant and quality and staff does not even come close to the brand name itself??

Went for a late lunch, about 3:30. Not busy at all, more than half the tables were empty. We were told there would be a 20 minute wait for a table. So we decided to eat at the bar. Maybe 10 people at bar when we got there. Ordered a regular coke for hubby and a long.island ice tea for me.  endless app, BBQ chicken salad for other half and a cheeseburger. Had to ask for more apps, had to ask for another drink. Bartender had an attitude. Not going back. Don't waste your time or money

On 9/16 I asked the manager on duty to switch to a particular football game and he ignored the request. In general they do a terrible job of managing their tvs. On an NFL Sunday at 1:00pm half of them will be on ESPNU.  I guess they consider that good enough. They don't seem to consider the tvs as part of their product. Maybe that comes from the top down.  If that's the case they should rip out all the tvs and just leave gaping holes of exposed wire--at least you would know what you were getting as soon as you walked in.

If I could have given a zero star that's what I would have given! This is our third visit (and LAST), and each time has been a horrible experience! Our order was incorrect, yet again! The manager seems to care less that my order was incorrect and our waiter told us it couldn't be corrected because the restaurant was out of the prime rib for another sandwich....WTW???

Listen!  This place is only getting 1 star because there isn't an option to give ZERO stars or rate with negative stars.  When my friend mentioned wanting to go to this location... mentally my mind just shut down but I said... maybe it isn't what I know in my heart that it is. *insert side eye*  From start to finish... it was bad.  I walked in to be seated.  I was immediately "greeted" (for lack of better terms) by 2 employees going back and forth about why one was rushing to seat people.  The entire conversation was inappropriate on every level.  Finally, I was asked how many people were in my party.  I waited while they checked availability.  A party of 7 came in after me and I noticed the hostess took their name but didn't take mine.  When I asked why my name wasn't written, I was told to go put my name on the list.  I gave the employee a strange look ... I was LOST!!!  I guess she noticed the look on my face and realized what she said sounded foolish.  She then directed me to a seat.  The restaurant smelled like sour mop water (as if they had mopped and wiped the tables with a dirty cloth).   It took the waitress an abnormal amount of time to come over and take drink orders.  We ordered non-alcoholic beverages and it took another 10-15 for those to come out.  Ordered boneless wings and a salad.  AN HOUR LATER -- I was told that I would need to order something else because they were out of lettuce.  WAIT WHAT?!?!!?!?  I'm sorry did you say... "YALL ARE OUT OF LETTUCE?!?!"  (I needed to emphasize that.)  The response was "Yes, we have been busy today."  Ok whatever.  I look at the menu to decide what else I want.  She came back out and said... we are out of shrimp too.  OH BOY!  I ordered Whiskey Glazed Chicken.  Food came out... broccolli was dry and brown... entire plate of food ... cold.  Sent the food back... 30-45 minutes later... food came back.  Broccolli was still dry and burnt.  Sigh...  At this point, I was just over it.  REMIND YOU... not one single manager came out to apologize for the low quality meal or low quality of service.  I won't return.  NOPE!!!!
Worst. Costumer. Service. Ever. I waited there for about 10 minutes none of the hostesses acknowledged me, but instead were on the phone and talking to each other. Horrible.

Excellent service tonight. Customer service has improved! Keep up the good work! New Service Manager Greg is doing an awesome job. Immediately could recognize the  service here has improved significantly.

Not at all surprised this location has so few stars. I arrived to find out the wait time since the parking lot was full. Another party arrived shortly after me. They were asked how many immediately upon walking in. I was asked as an after thought. We were seated pretty quickly after being told there's a 20 min wait; so that was good. The waitress comes over introduces herself and ask for our drink order. Still going good at this point but that's where It stops. The drinks take a while to come out but I can see the bar from our seats. I can also see into the kitchen. The waitress takes our app and entree orders. More waiting. Apps come out and they seem ok. The food takes so long that we're pretty full from the apps that are almost completely gone. The food comes and my naan bread is burned. Toasted and burned are too different things. It was supposed to be toasted. My daughter asks how's she supposed to eat her salad. I tell her I don't know since we were never given utensils. The waitress hasn't stopped by our table since we put in the food order. I can't get anyone's attention get utensils and napkins. At this point I'm ready to go. I see two sets of utensils at the register behind me so I help myself so we can eat. I'm disappointed in the way my food looks but I decided to eat the filling of my sandwich; that was good. The waitress finally comes over so I ask for napkins. More waiting...for napkins??? We've eaten all that we want and use the restrooms. I request to go boxes and the check. Give my card and wait some more because the register froze while closing out my check. I finally get my card and can leave the restaurant. I probably won't be returning to that location. Two bad experiences there was enough for me.

Not many late night options in Morrow for weary travelers so Friday's was our only option. Good thing. The service was great and friendly. The food was well prepared and served fresh. The Bourbon Plank Chicken was outstanding. Good healthy choice. Come hungry! Come late!!

to be honest, i'm just posting this out of boredom, but  the hours listed for this location are for the bar, not for dine-in. dine-in closes one hour earlier, meaning food stops at 10 on sundays 12 on fridays and saturday 11 on all other nights i'm posting this because it's 2am, I'm bored and can not sleep after the listed times, the bar is open but food service stops MEANING MOST OF THE STAFF IS GETTING READY TO GO HOME  THAT IS ALL.
Oscar was an excellent waiter. The service was extraordinary and would recommend this restaurant to anyone!!!
